p: Based on Model B, we estimated the global A. aegypti annual abundance averaged over two periods, 1951–1970 and 1996–2015, as shown in Figure 6. This analysis considers the change in climate, population and GDPpc. Over the 45-year time span, the vector density increased. The area with higher population density of A. aegypti is postdicted to spread from coastal areas toward more continental areas, following patterns of economic activity and higher human population density.
